programme.desc: Rescuers (Lloyd Nolan, Walter Abel) scour uncharted arctic expanses for a missing plane, while its downed crew (John Wayne) struggles to survive.

programme.title: Windtalkers (2002)
programme.desc: In World War II, a Marine (Nicolas Cage) protects a Navajo recruit (Adam Beach) who transmits messages in his native tongue, confounding Japanese code-breakers.

programme.title: White House Down (2013)
programme.desc: While on a tour of the White House with his young daughter, a Capitol policeman springs into action to save his child and protect the president from a heavily armed group of paramilitary invaders.

programme.title: Shooter (2007)
programme.desc: Reluctantly pressed into service again, a former military sniper plots revenge against his powerful foes after being betrayed and wounded.

programme.title: The Mechanic (2011)
programme.desc: An elite hitman teaches his trade to an apprentice who has a connection to one of his previous victims.

programme.title: A Simple Plan (1998)
programme.desc: A Minnesotan (Bill Paxton), his dimwitted brother (Billy Bob Thornton) and his brothers redneck friend (Brent Briscoe) find and decide to keep $4 million.

programme.title: Fargo (1996)
programme.desc: A pregnant police chief (Frances McDormand) probes the murderous events that evolved from a desperate car salesmans (William H. Macy) kidnapping scheme.

programme.title: In the Land of Saints and Sinners (2023)
programme.sub-title: In the Land of Saints and Sinners (2023)
programme.desc: Hoping to leave his dark past behind him, former assassin Finbar Murphy leads a quiet life in a coastal Irish town. However, when terrorists show up, he must soon choose between exposing his secret identity and defending his friends and neighbors.

programme.title: White House Down (2013)
programme.desc: While on a tour of the White House with his young daughter, a Capitol policeman springs into action to save his child and protect the president from a heavily armed group of paramilitary invaders.

programme.title: Transformers: The Last Knight (2017)
programme.desc: As war with the Transformers rages on, inventor Cade Yeager forms an unlikely alliance with Bumblebee, an English lord and an Oxford professor to save the planet.

programme.title: Death Wish 4: The Crackdown (1987)
programme.desc: The vigilante architect (Charles Bronson) targets Los Angeles drug rings after the death of his girlfriends (Kay Lenz) daughter.

programme.title: My Dead Boyfriend (2016)
programme.desc: A woman (Heather Graham) goes on a manic quest to learn the truth about her boyfriend after she finds him dead on their couch.

programme.title: Gung Ho (1986)
programme.desc: American autoworkers have a hard time accepting new work ethics when a Japanese car manufacturer takes over.

programme.title: The Purple Rose of Cairo (1985)
programme.desc: A 1930s movie star (Jeff Daniels) steps off the screen to join a waitress (Mia Farrow) in the audience.
The son (Robert De Niro) of a landowner and the son (Gerard Depardieu) of a peasant become enemies in 20th-century Italy.

programme.title: Allan Quatermain and the Lost City of Gold (1987)
programme.sub-title: Allan Quatermain and the Lost City of Gold (1987)
programme.desc: An explorer (Richard Chamberlain), his archaeologist girlfriend (Sharon Stone) and a Zulu warrior (James Earl Jones) find a jungle city.

programme.title: Death at a Funeral (2007)
programme.desc: Secret revelations and chaos reign when members of a dysfunctional British family gather to lay their patriarch to rest.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture (1979)
programme.desc: Adm. Kirk (William Shatner), Mr. Spock (Leonard Nimoy), Dr. McCoy (DeForest Kelley) and crew embark in the overhauled Enterprise to find an intelligent entity called VGER.

programme.title: Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan (1982)
programme.sub-title: Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan (1982)
programme.desc: Kirk (William Shatner), Spock (Leonard Nimoy) and the Enterprise crew battle an old foe (Ricardo Montalban) who blames Kirk for the death of his wife.

programme.title: Star Trek III: The Search for Spock (1984)
programme.sub-title: Star Trek III: The Search for Spock (1984)
programme.desc: Kirk (William Shatner) and the crew steal the old Enterprise and head for Vulcan to reunite the mind and body of Mr. Spock.

programme.title: Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home (1986)
programme.sub-title: Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home (1986)
programme.desc: Spock (Leonard Nimoy), Kirk (William Shatner) and the Enterprise time-travel to modern-day San Francisco to bring humpback whales to the 23rd century.

programme.title: Star Trek V: The Final Frontier (1989)
programme.sub-title: Star Trek V: The Final Frontier (1989)
programme.desc: A renegade Vulcan makes Kirk (William Shatner), Spock (Leonard Nimoy), McCoy (DeForest Kelley) and the Enterprise go to a planet at the center of the galaxy.

programme.title: Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country (1991)
programme.sub-title: Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country (1991)
programme.desc: Kirk (William Shatner), Spock (Leonard Nimoy), McCoy (DeForest Kelley) and the Enterprise encounter sabotage on the way to peace talks with the Klingon Federation.

programme.title: A Shot in the Dark (1964)
programme.desc: Clumsy Inspector Clouseau (Peter Sellers) visits a nudist camp to prove a French maid (Elke Sommer) innocent of murder.

programme.title: Transformers One (2024)
programme.desc: Brothers-in-arms Orion Pax and D-16 become sworn enemies Optimus Prime and Megatron.

programme.title: Max (2015)
programme.desc: The family of a fallen Marine adopts his traumatized service dog, giving both the four-legged veteran and a troubled teen the chance to heal.

programme.title: Orange County (2002)
programme.desc: A high schooler (Colin Hanks) tries to fix a mistake after his guidance counselor sends the wrong papers to Stanford University.

programme.title: An Inconvenient Sequel: Truth to Power (2017)
programme.sub-title: An Inconvenient Sequel: Truth to Power (2017)
programme.desc: Former Vice President Al Gore continues his tireless fight, traveling around the world to train an army of activists and influence international climate policy.

programme.title: Rivers Edge (1987)
programme.desc: Small-town teens (Crispin Glover, Keanu Reeves) react oddly after a peer strangles his girlfriend and shows them the corpse.

programme.title: The Pope of Greenwich Village (1984)
programme.desc: Two cousins (Eric Roberts, Mickey Rourke) try to get rich quick with a racehorse and mob money in New Yorks Little Italy.

programme.title: Cast Away (2000)
programme.desc: A corporate troubleshooter survives a plane crash to spend five years seeking out an existence on a deserted island before returning to civilization with an altered view of his old life and values.

programme.title: Novocaine (2025)
programme.desc: When the girl of his dreams gets kidnapped, a man turns his inability to feel pain into an unexpected advantage. He fights a bunch of thugs to get her back.

programme.title: Baywatch (2017)
programme.desc: When a dangerous crime wave hits the beach, Mitch Buchannon leads his elite squad of lifeguards on a mission to prove that you dont have to wear a badge to save the bay.

programme.title: Desperately Seeking Susan (1985)
programme.desc: A bored housewife (Rosanna Arquette) with amnesia thinks she is "Susan," a wild woman (Madonna) on the run.

programme.title: The Cutting Edge (1992)
programme.desc: An ex-hockey player (D.B. Sweeney) and a prima donna (Moira Kelly) bicker as paired figure skaters shooting for the Olympics.

programme.title: The Deep House (2021)
programme.desc: While diving in a remote French lake, two YouTubers who specialize in underwater exploration videos discover a house submerged in deep waters. Their dive turns into a nightmare when they discover the house was the scene of atrocious crimes.

programme.title: Galaxy Quest (1999)
programme.desc: Aliens, believing actors to be real heroes, enlist cast members of a sci-fi TV series to help save their people.

programme.title: Unprotected Sets
programme.desc: Nothing is off limits for Marlena Rodriguez; Ali Sultan reflects on his journey from the Middle East to Minnesota.

programme.title: Married to the Mob (1988)
programme.desc: An FBI agent (Matthew Modine) gets close to a gangsters widow (Michelle Pfeiffer) in order to nab a crime boss (Dean Stockwell).

programme.title: Birdman of Alcatraz (1962)
programme.desc: Murderer Robert Stroud (Burt Lancaster) spends decades in solitary confinement studying birds and their diseases.

programme.title: True Grit (1969)
programme.desc: One-eyed Marshal "Rooster" Cogburn (John Wayne) and a Texas Ranger (Glen Campbell) help a girl (Kim Darby) find her fathers killer.

programme.title: Pocket Listing (2015)
programme.desc: When a power player and his sultry wife hire a disgraced property broker to discreetly market and sell their Malibu villa, double crosses, adultery, murder and revenge ensue.

programme.title: Fluke (1995)
programme.desc: A family man (Matthew Modine) killed in a car accident charms his widow (Nancy Travis) and son as a golden retriever.

programme.title: The Tomorrow War (2021)
programme.desc: Soldiers and civilians travel to the year 2051 to join a global war against a deadly alien species.

programme.title: The Firm (1993)
programme.desc: A law-school grad uncovers a sinister secret about the Tennessee firm that made him an offer he couldnt refuse.

programme.title: Gangs of New York (2002)
programme.desc: During the era of Tammany Halls sway, a young man (Leonardo DiCaprio) vows vengeance on the vicious gangster (Daniel Day-Lewis) who killed his father.

programme.title: Trading Places (1983)
programme.desc: Sporting billionaire brothers reverse the roles of a Wall Street commodities broker (Dan Aykroyd) and a street hustler (Eddie Murphy).

programme.title: Baby Driver (2017)
programme.desc: Coerced into working for a crime boss, a talented getaway driver must face the music when a doomed heist threatens his life, love and freedom.

programme.title: Everybody Wants Some!! (2016)
programme.desc: In 1980 Texas, a college freshman (Blake Jenner) meets his new baseball teammates (Will Brittain, Ryan Guzman), an unruly group of disco-dancing, skirt-chasing partyers.

programme.title: College (2008)
programme.desc: Three high-school seniors (Drake Bell, Andrew Caldwell, Kevin Covais) spend a wild weekend with members of Fairmont Universitys rowdiest fraternity.

programme.title: Jackass: Number Two (2006)
programme.desc: Daredevils go for the gross-out when they subject an unsuspecting public to more outrageous stunts and practical jokes.

programme.title: From Dusk Till Dawn (1996)
programme.desc: Desperado brothers (George Clooney, Quentin Tarantino) kidnap a preacher (Harvey Keitel) and his kids, commandeer their RV and wind up in a Mexican strip joint where vampires lurk.

programme.title: I See You (2019)
programme.desc: Strange occurrences plague a small-town detective and his family as he investigates the disappearance of a boy.

programme.title: Star Trek: First Contact (1996)
programme.desc: Picard (Patrick Stewart), Riker (Jonathan Frakes) and the others set off to stop the half-robot Borg from sabotaging the first warp drive flight in 2063.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible -- Ghost Protocol (2011)
programme.desc: The IMF is shut down when its implicated in the bombing of the Kremlin, causing Ethan Hunt and his new team to go rogue to clear their organizations name.

programme.title: The Hunt for Red October (1990)
programme.desc: Moscow, Washington and a CIA analyst (Alec Baldwin) track a renegade Soviet captain (Sean Connery) and his new submarine.

programme.title: Witness (1985)
programme.desc: An eight-year-old Amish boy witnesses a drug-related murder in a Philadelphia train station. The Philadelphia police captain discovers that the murderers are cops trying to squelch a corruption investigation.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible II (2000)
programme.desc: IMF agent Ethan Hunt is sent to Sydney to find and destroy a genetically modified disease called Chimera.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible III (2006)
programme.desc: Now a trainer for IMF recruits, agent Ethan Hunt squares off against the toughest foe he has ever faced, a ruthless arms and information broker.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible -- Ghost Protocol (2011)
programme.desc: The IMF is shut down when its implicated in the bombing of the Kremlin, causing Ethan Hunt and his new team to go rogue to clear their organizations name.

programme.title: Cop Land (1997)
programme.desc: The sheriff (Sylvester Stallone) of a small New Jersey police community confronts key men (Harvey Keitel, Ray Liotta) on both sides of a law-enforcement cover-up.

programme.title: Gone Baby Gone (2007)
programme.desc: Two private investigators (Casey Affleck, Michelle Monaghan) tread dangerous ground as they scour the Boston underworld for a kidnapped child.

programme.title: Lust and Redemption (2023)
programme.desc: A ranch owner named Samantha rejects an offer from a rich land developer, but her daughter falls for the developers hot son. A surprising discovery is made as help comes from an unexpected source.

programme.title: Jackass Presents: Bad Grandpa (2013)
programme.desc: Irving Zisman (Johnny Knoxville) takes his young and impressionable grandson (Jackson Nicoll) on a cross-country trip in which they encounter male strippers, biker-bar patrons and other unsuspecting citizens.

programme.title: Jackass: The Movie (2002)
programme.desc: Nitwits (Johnny Knoxville, Bam Margera, Chris Pontius) perform outrageous stunts and pull practical jokes on an unsuspecting public.

programme.title: American Selfie: One Nation Shoots Itself
programme.desc: Alexandra Pelosi captures a snapshot of America as the country faces a pandemic, a presidential election and a costly financial collapse.

programme.title: The Painter (2024)
programme.desc: An ex-CIA operative is tracked down by a young woman and they become entangled in an unauthorized black ops program.

programme.title: Star Trek: Nemesis (2002)
programme.desc: The crew (Jonathan Frakes, Brent Spiner) of the Enterprise must prevent a replica of Capt. Picard (Patrick Stewart) from overtaking Earth.

programme.title: Fatman (2020)
programme.desc: After receiving a lump of coal in his stocking, a disgruntled 12-year-old hires a highly skilled assassin to kill Santa Claus.

programme.title: Noah (2014)
programme.desc: God chooses Noah (Russell Crowe) to build an ark and save the animals and his family from an apocalyptic flood.

programme.title: Before Dawn (2024)
programme.desc: A young man joins his countrymen on the Western front of World War I, hoping to expedite an end to the bloody conflict. However, as the battle rages on, hes forced to grapple with the brutal realities of trench warfare.

programme.title: Major League (1989)
programme.desc: Lackluster baseball players (Tom Berenger, Charlie Sheen, Corbin Bernsen) hear their Cleveland teams new owner is counting on them to lose.

programme.title: Grudge Match (2013)
programme.desc: A boxing promoter (Kevin Hart) offers two rival boxers (Robert De Niro, Sylvester Stallone) the chance to come out of retirement for one final bout.

programme.title: The Other Guys (2010)
programme.desc: Two deskbound detectives get more than they bargain for when they take on a seemingly minor case that may turn out to be New Yorks biggest crime.

programme.title: Fatman (2020)
programme.desc: After receiving a lump of coal in his stocking, a disgruntled 12-year-old hires a highly skilled assassin to kill Santa Claus.

programme.title: Southpaw (2015)
programme.desc: After losing everything to a senseless tragedy, a boxer (Jake Gyllenhaal) turns to a retired fighter (Forest Whitaker) for guidance as he struggles toward redemption.

programme.title: Hotel Mumbai (2018)
programme.desc: Terror strikes in the heart of Mumbai, India, as members of Lashkar-e-Taiba storm the Taj Mahal Palace Hotel. Amid the gunfire and mayhem, a brave chef and kitchen worker decide to risk their own lives to try and protect the frightened guests.

programme.title: The Machinist (2004)
programme.desc: Cryptic notes and encounters with a mysterious stranger torment a drill-press operator (Christian Bale) who has not slept in a year.

programme.title: Wolves (2016)
programme.desc: A talented high school basketball players (Taylor John Smith) dreams of playing college ball are jeopardized by his hard-drinking fathers (Michael Shannon) compulsive gambling.

programme.title: 10 Cloverfield Lane (2016)
programme.desc: A woman (Mary Elizabeth Winstead) discovers the horrifying truth about the outside world while living in an underground shelter with two men (John Goodman, John Gallagher Jr.).

programme.title: Joe Dirt (2001)
programme.desc: A goofy janitor (David Spade) tells a radio talk-show host (Dennis Miller) about his search for the parents who abandoned him.

programme.title: Masterminds (2016)
programme.desc: An armored-car driver (Zach Galifianakis) helps a flirty co-worker (Kristen Wiig) and her friends pull off a heist, then finds himself holding the bag after they double-cross him.

programme.title: American Renegades (2017)
programme.desc: On assignment in war-torn Europe, Navy SEALs discover gold at the bottom of a lake -- a fortune rumored to be worth hundreds of millions of dollars. When the enemy detects the team, the SEALs are left with only 10 hours to recover the treasure.

programme.title: Top Gun (1986)
programme.desc: For Lieutenant Pete "Maverick" Mitchell and his friend and co-pilot Nick "Goose" Bradshaw, being accepted into an elite training school for fighter pilots is a dream come true. But a tragedy will threaten Petes dreams of becoming an ace pilot.

programme.title: Scream (1996)
programme.desc: A psycho killer targets a past victims daughter (Neve Campbell), while a tabloid TV reporter (Courteney Cox) homes in on his identity.
